content: "Australia is to announce about $73bn (£49bn) in defence spending aimed at equipping its military for the next two decades. Key purchases include 100 fighter jets and 12 new submarines, replacing the current fleet of six. Eight frigates and 24 combat helicopters are also on the list, in the country's first defence white paper for 10 years." ***http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/8030292.stm***
